thread.title: Newly authenticated Billy the Kid photo could be worth $5 million
thread.title_full: Newly authenticated Billy the Kid photo could be worth $5 million

author: Erin Edgemon | eedgemon@al.com
title: Newly authenticated Billy the Kid photo could be worth $5 million
text:
Comments 
Sometimes rummaging through yard sales and thrift shops pays off, but rarely does anyone have the luck of California-based Old West memorabilia collector, Randy Guijarro. 
One day five years ago, Guijarro walked into a junk shop in Fresno and began digging through a bunch of old photographs. 
He picked out three of the oldest, including one 1878 tintype of 18 people standing in front of an old schoolhouse playing croquet. He paid only $2. 
Guijarro just had a feeling: "This guy is Billy the Kid," he told KSEE 24 . 
Who are the rest of the people in the photo? They are members of Billy's infamous gang of Regulators. 
With only one known photograph of Billy the Kid in existence (billionaire William Koch bought it in 2011 for $2.3 million) it took Guijarro five years to authenticate it. Now, he thinks it is worth about $5 million. 
The story of how Guijarro and his wife, Linda, were able to authenticate the photograph will be told tonight in the new National Geographic Channel show "Billy the Kid: New Evidence." The program will air at 8 p.m. CST. Is this photo worth $5 million? #BillytheKid : New Evidence. TONIGHT 9/8c pic.twitter.com/KAIlHbQfPc
